poem:
"Origami of Diplomacy"

Plucked from morning papers, a tale unfolds,
As the Mossad whisper terror like old friends,
Slyly weaving threats among the pressing folds.
Nine years a spider spins, but what it mends
Or ruins, depends on which wind holds.
Such heat in this game of shadowy chess,
Where the board is global, and pawns – us.
Yet, the morning remains anyone's guess.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wednesday briefing: How Israeli intelligence spent nine years interfering with an international court Good morning. “You should help us and let us take care of you. You don’t want to be getting into things that could compromise your security or that of your family.” That is a terrifying message for anyone to hear from the head of the Mossad, Israel’s foreign intelligence agency. Even more astonishing is that this was a message to the chief". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
